isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: LEECE NEVILLE AND PRESTOLITE JN SERIES - COMPONENT TESTING - STATOR TEST

svcproc.title: STATOR TEST
svcproc.para: Use a Wheatstone Bridge or an ohmmeter capable of measuring 1/1000 ohm to check stator for grounds and for phase resistance. Stator is OK when no circuit is present between lamination and each of the three leads, and resistance readings across each phase are approximately the same. It is suggested that stators be "high pot" tested by a qualified electrical shop to help identify borderline stators.

warning.para: The "high pot" test can cause severe injury or death. This test is restricted to qualified personnel only.

note.para: Stator must be disconnected from alternator to perform this test ( Figure 16).

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. WHEATSTONE BRIDGE OR OHMMETER WITH 1/1000 OHM SCALE (USED IN ALL TESTS)

svcproc.para: Defective stators or ones with damaged or charred windings must be discarded regardless of how they test.
Several stators are available which can be used as service replacements on these alternators. The part numbers of these stators will be listed in the appropriate parts list.
